title: [十月驚奇?]  侵稅務風波  NYT:侵逃稅  侵:其實我比咗好多

replies.msg:
其實侵稅務已經比人針咗好耐 係岩岩NYT再有新報導 有D具體數字

侵: 我條數比IRS睇緊 之後我就會公開比你地睇 IRS有心拖咗好耐
https://twitter.com/BBCWorld/status/1310533490715361282?s=20

Donald Trump paid just $750 (£580) in federal income tax both in 2016, the year he ran for the US presidency, and in his first year in the White House, the New York Times says.

The newspaper - which says it obtained tax records for Mr Trump and his companies over two decades - also says that he paid no income taxes at all in 10 of the previous 15 years.
The records reveal "chronic losses and years of tax avoidance", it says.
Mr Trump called the report "fake news".

"Actually I paid tax. And you'll see that as soon as my tax returns - it's under audit, they've been under audit for a long time," he told reporters after the story was published on Sunday.
"The IRS [Internal Revenue Service] does not treat me well… they treat me very badly," he said.

replies.msg:
I have been tax auditor for over 35 years.

Trump did not evade tax

Even if IRS found that he or his companies has errors in the income tax returns, that is NOT consider tax evasion.

There is nothing wrong with company paying no income taxes or get a huge tax refund. For a business (corporations , partnership or sole proprietor) and if you incurred tax losses in the current year, you are allow to use that loss to offset income in current year or carry them back to previous years (3 years in Canada) that the company has earned taxable income and paid taxes. The company HAD to pay those taxes in previous year in order to get a tax refund when the company losses money in the current year...

I have seen very large corporations that did not pay any income taxes because of various "legal" deductions and adjustments etc. under the Income Tax Act or IRS Code in USA.

Tax EVASION is a crime. Trump have Tax professional to prepare his personal and Company's income tax returns. They dared not risk their professional licences to help Trump "EVADE" tax.

Trump donated his annual salary of $400,000 to various federal departments.
Trump has donated more than taxes paid by many previous presidents.


Federal taxes paid, first year in office
Ronald Reagan: $165,202
George H.W. Bush: $101,382
Bill Clinton: $62,670
George W. Bush: $250,221
Barack Obama: $1,792,414
Donald Trump: $750 but donated $400,000

Presidents Who Did Not Take a Salary
The Constitution requires a president to take a salary. The Founding Fathers wanted to protect even wealthy presidents from misfortune that could tempt them to take bribes. The salary may have also been designed to ensure that a lack of personal wealth would not prohibit a president-elect from taking office.

Four presidents refused a salary. Instead, they donated all or part of it.

Donald J. Trump donates his $400,000 annual salary to various federal departments. 5 Trump's net worth is $3.1 billion, according to Forbes

replies.msg:
不過呢樣又真係矛盾大對決
國家元首嘅乜野先係公眾有知情權
如果有犯法其實leak都合理
如果無就 .....

1. 佢個 Group 有過億 Tax Losses Carried Forward

簡單黎講, 你生意蝕錢可以記數, 將來賺錢可以用黎抵消應課稅收入數.
Yr1 : ($5,000,000) : ($5,000,000 記落下年)
Yr2 : $2,000,000 : ($3,000,000 記落下年)
Yr3 : $4,000,000 : $1,000,000 應課稅收入

2. 美國有法例你可以 "Clawback" 上四四年交過既稅
3. 佢利用好多 Investment Withdrawal 當 Deduction (合法)
4. 佢 "人車合一" 將自己同生意融為一體. 所以好多 "個人開支" 佢當做生意支出
5. 佢好識得利用折舊 (Depreciation) 黎減低稅項
6. 將親人間交易商業化做財產轉移

好多人唔熟嘗商業稅法, 用自己個人所知既個人稅法去睇一定亂晒龍.

我就咁睇佢最多係會比人挑戰 Tax Deductibility (Business Substance), 同埋點 imply the tax law.

但係我睇佢稅務團隊好識 Tax Law, 其實真係熟讀 Tax Law 就會搵到好多位拎 Refund 同 Rebate.

西媒家下主要 focus 係平民大眾, 因為佢地無可能明白太多稅法同埋道理.
大眾主要就係睇文字描述, 真係好撚顛.

quote.msg:
I have been tax auditor for over 35 years.

Trump did not evade tax

Even if IRS found that he or his companies has errors in the income tax returns, that is NOT consider tax evasion.

There is nothing wrong with company paying no income taxes or get a huge tax refund. For a business (corporations , partnership or sole proprietor) and if you incurred tax losses in the current year, you are allow to use that loss to offset income in current year or carry them back to previous years (3 years in Canada) that the company has earned taxable income and paid taxes. The company HAD to pay those taxes in previous year in order to get a tax refund when the company losses money in the current year...

I have seen very large corporations that did not pay any income taxes because of various "legal" deductions and adjustments etc. under the Income Tax Act or IRS Code in USA.

Tax EVASION is a crime. Trump have Tax professional to prepare his personal and Company's income tax returns. They dared not risk their professional licences to help Trump "EVADE" tax.

Trump donated his annual salary of $400,000 to various federal departments.
Trump has donated more than taxes paid by many previous presidents.


Federal taxes paid, first year in office
Ronald Reagan: $165,202
George H.W. Bush: $101,382
Bill Clinton: $62,670
George W. Bush: $250,221
Barack Obama: $1,792,414
Donald Trump: $750 but donated $400,000

Presidents Who Did Not Take a Salary
The Constitution requires a president to take a salary. The Founding Fathers wanted to protect even wealthy presidents from misfortune that could tempt them to take bribes. The salary may have also been designed to ensure that a lack of personal wealth would not prohibit a president-elect from taking office.

Four presidents refused a salary. Instead, they donated all or part of it.

Donald J. Trump donates his $400,000 annual salary to various federal departments. 5 Trump's net worth is $3.1 billion, according to Forbes

pinned.msg:
1. 佢個 Group 有過億 Tax Losses Carried Forward

簡單黎講, 你生意蝕錢可以記數, 將來賺錢可以用黎抵消應課稅收入數.
Yr1 : ($5,000,000) : ($5,000,000 記落下年)
Yr2 : $2,000,000 : ($3,000,000 記落下年)
Yr3 : $4,000,000 : $1,000,000 應課稅收入

2. 美國有法例你可以 "Clawback" 上四四年交過既稅
3. 佢利用好多 Investment Withdrawal 當 Deduction (合法)
4. 佢 "人車合一" 將自己同生意融為一體. 所以好多 "個人開支" 佢當做生意支出
5. 佢好識得利用折舊 (Depreciation) 黎減低稅項
6. 將親人間交易商業化做財產轉移

好多人唔熟嘗商業稅法, 用自己個人所知既個人稅法去睇一定亂晒龍.

我就咁睇佢最多係會比人挑戰 Tax Deductibility (Business Substance), 同埋點 imply the tax law.

但係我睇佢稅務團隊好識 Tax Law, 其實真係熟讀 Tax Law 就會搵到好多位拎 Refund 同 Rebate.
